learning_outcomes.description: Investigate and critically review the role of the midwife and the need to consult and refer with other health professionals to provide safe comprehensive care for the woman with complexities in pregnancy, labour and the postpartum period, including rural and remote health services.

Analyse common medical conditions that women experience in pregnancy and their effect on both mother and baby and examine strategies in providing culturally responsive woman-centred care to women as they are challenged by and deal with the physical and psychological complications of high-risk birthing.
Critically examine the pathophysiology of, diagnosis, and evidence for treatment of, and expected outcomes associated with complex medical conditions of significance to midwifery practice.

Investigate and advocate for the importance midwives have in providing health promotion and prevention strategies for women with complex medical conditions including women from culturally and diverse backgrounds.

Critically review how contemporary and relevant evidence can be used to inform midwifery care of women with complex health needs with a particular focus on the use of digital health technology to improve health outcomes.

assessments.due_date: Presentations will be held over the semester weeks 3-11 during the PBL tutorial. Presentations are required to be submitted to gradebook for marking on the agreed presentation date.
assessments.task_description:
The aim of this assessment is to develop your knowledge and understanding of the care and management of a woman with a complex health condition in the antenatal, intrapartum and postpartum care cycles. You will be required to present this knowledge in a group presentation. Although this will be presented as a group, you will be marked individually.



Â
assessments.submission_guidelines: Your power point slides are to be submitted to the blackboard course group discussion board and gradebook for marking purposes on the agreed presentation date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The examination will be through the INSPERA platform and will be held online, on campus and will be invigilated.

Examination content will be taken from lectures, learning modules and readings.

Further information regarding the examination will be provided throughout the semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Midwifery specific lecture content will be provided by UQ Midwifery and Guest Lecturers and provides knowledge essential for midwifery practice. Please check individual timetables, attendance is highly recommended.

learning_activities.topic:
Problem Based Learning workshops

These sessions will be held as per the UQ timetable biweekly across the semester. Attendance at these workshops are highly recommended as learning and assessment for this course are linked to this activity.
